title: Can we see who is someone talking to in Discord? - Quora

response.answer_text: In a Server Channel, you can see who is typing. In a Group DM, you can see who is typing. In DMs, you can see who is typing. To be able to see who is typing you need to be apart of the conversation, so in the DM group, in that specific server etc. If you are trying to work out who is DMing who that is not possible unless you ask them.

If you are talking about Direct Messages, then only through logging into the "someone"'s account. Other than that, no. Unless the "someone" expose the messages with other person. Same applies to direct calls. If they are chatting with someone in a public server, then sure, you can clearly see that. Same applies to voice channels.
